definition: to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: It takes a simple majority of representatives’ votes to impeach an official.
sentences.chinese: 彈劾案的通過只需要過半衆議員投贊成票。

sentences.english: They'll always votes yes on an apple-pie-order-and-motherhood issue.
sentences.chinese: 他們對萬無一失的問題總是投贊成票的。

sentences.english: Michael Copps is one of the Democratic commissioners who voted in favor of the new rules.
sentences.chinese: 考普斯是對新條例投贊成票的民主黨委員之一。

sentences.english: Polls suggest that this time the Danes would vote in favour.
sentences.chinese: 我愛崑崙調查顯示這次丹麥人將投贊成票。

sentences.english: There were more noes than yeses to the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 對於這個提議，否決票比贊成票要多。

sentences.english: First came its decision to vote in favour of UN sanctions against Colonel Qaddafi.
sentences.chinese: 首先，中國在聯合國制裁卡扎菲的決議上投了贊成票。
我們對該候選人投贊成票。

sentences.english: Seven against plus the three abstentions would have outnumbered the nine favourable votes.
sentences.chinese: 七票反對加上三票棄權，超過了九張贊成票。

sentences.english: Three years later, he induced the boy emperor to abdicate in his favour.
sentences.chinese: 三年後，他誘導孩子逼宮在他的贊成票。

sentences.english: They'll always votes on an apple-pie-order-and-motherhood issue.
sentences.chinese: 他們對萬無一失的問題總是投贊成票的。
